| size = 13 [[Megabyte|MB]] â Windows<ref name="sizes" /><br /> 28 MB â Mac OS X<ref name="sizes" /><br /> 15 MB â Linux (i686)<ref name="sizes" /><br />16 MB â Linux (x86_64)<ref name="sizes" /><br /> 66 MB â source code<ref name="sizes">{{cite web |url=https://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/mozilla.org/firefox/releases/latest/ |title=Latest stable Firefox release |publisher=Mozilla |date=2011-09-27 |accessdate=2011-09-29}}</ref>

Line 31: Line 31:
Features include [[Tab (GUI)|tabbed browsing]], [[Spell checker|spell checking]], [[incremental find]], [[Live bookmarks|live bookmarking]], a [[download manager]], [[Privacy mode|private browsing]], location-aware browsing (also known as "[[geolocation]]") based exclusively on a [[Google]] service<ref name="mozgeo">{{cite web|title = Location-Aware Browsing|url = http://www.mozilla.com/firefox/geolocation/|accessdate = 2009-07-05|publisher = Mozilla Corp}} (section "''What information is being sent, and to whom? (...)''")</ref> and an integrated search system that uses Google by default in most localizations. Functions can be added through [[List of Firefox extensions|extensions]], created by [[third-party developer]]s,<ref name="mozilla1">{{cite web|url=https://addons.mozilla.org/firefox/browse/type:1/cat:all |title=Browse all extensions page |publisher=Addons.mozilla.org |date= |accessdate=2011-08-17}}</ref> of which there is a wide selection, a feature that has attracted many of Firefox's users.
Features include [[Tab (GUI)|tabbed browsing]], [[Spell checker|spell checking]], [[incremental find]], [[Live bookmarks|live bookmarking]], a [[download manager]], [[Privacy mode|private browsing]], location-aware browsing (also known as "[[geolocation]]") based exclusively on a [[Google]] service<ref name="mozgeo">{{cite web|title = Location-Aware Browsing|url = http://www.mozilla.com/firefox/geolocation/|accessdate = 2009-07-05|publisher = Mozilla Corp}} (section "''What information is being sent, and to whom? (...)''")</ref> and an integrated search system that uses Google by default in most localizations. Functions can be added through [[List of Firefox extensions|extensions]], created by [[third-party developer]]s,<ref name="mozilla1">{{cite web|url=https://addons.mozilla.org/firefox/browse/type:1/cat:all |title=Browse all extensions page |publisher=Addons.mozilla.org |date= |accessdate=2011-08-17}}</ref> of which there is a wide selection, a feature that has attracted many of Firefox's users.
â
Firefox runs on various [[operating systems]] including [[Microsoft Windows]], [[GNU/Linux]], [[Mac OS X]], [[FreeBSD]], and many other platforms. Its current stable release is version 7.0.1, released on {{as of|2011|09|29|alt=September 29, 2011}}.<ref name="release notes">{{cite web |title = Mozilla Firefox 7.0 Release Notes|publisher = Mozilla|url = http://www.mozilla.com/en-US/firefox/7.0/releasenotes/|accessdate = 2011-09-27}}</ref> Firefox's [[source code]] is [[Multi-licensing|tri-licensed]] under the [[GNU General Public License|GNU GPL]], [[GNU Lesser General Public License|GNU LGPL]], or [[Mozilla Public License]].<ref name="mozilla_code_licensing">{{cite web |url=http://www.mozilla.org/MPL/ |title=Mozilla Code Licensing|accessdate=2007-09-17 |author=Mozilla Foundation}}</ref>
+
Firefox runs on various [[operating systems]] including [[Microsoft Windows]], [[Linux]], [[Mac OS X]], [[FreeBSD]], and many other platforms. Its current stable release is version 7.0.1, released on {{as of|2011|09|29|alt=September 29, 2011}}.<ref name="release notes">{{cite web |title = Mozilla Firefox 7.0 Release Notes|publisher = Mozilla|url = http://www.mozilla.com/en-US/firefox/7.0/releasenotes/|accessdate = 2011-09-27}}</ref> Firefox's [[source code]] is [[Multi-licensing|tri-licensed]] under the [[GNU General Public License|GNU GPL]], [[GNU Lesser General Public License|GNU LGPL]], or [[Mozilla Public License]].<ref name="mozilla_code_licensing">{{cite web |url=http://www.mozilla.org/MPL/ |title=Mozilla Code Licensing|accessdate=2007-09-17 |author=Mozilla Foundation}}</ref>
